title: Internship Quantitative Investment Strategies (m/f/d)*
description:
The Group Investment Management (GIM) division is responsible for managing the proprietary Munich Re and ERGO investment portfolio of around €230bn. Within the business unit Investment Strategies of GIM the Tactical Asset Allocation department is responsible for the tactical asset allocation (TAA) of the whole Munich Re Group. This means building a granular TAA on the basis of the long-term strategic allocation (SAA) and regularly updating it to reflect changes in the political/economic environment and movements on the capital markets. The department brings together experts in all liquid asset classes and markets. Portfolio positions in all asset classes are weighted using quantitative and qualitative methods to achieve an efficient investment portfolio. Within this challenging environment you will strengthen the team as an intern within the department “Tactical Asset Allocation“. We are looking for a candidate with strong quantitative and data analytics skills.

Your Job
• Support the investment managers in generating trading ideas and searching for investment opportunities
• Research quantitative methods to analyze and predict capital markets
• Implement quantitative models in Python
• Enhance our quantitative capital markets analysis tools

Your Profile
• Student of mathematics, science, computer science, economics or business administration with a quantitative orientation and excellent grades
• Solid programming skills are required, preferably Python
• Knowledge of quantitative methods, statistics, machine learning, financial mathematics, data analysis or econometric approaches
• Interest in capital markets

Students from countries outside the EU require a German residence-/work permit. The first master’s degree may not have been completed before/during the entire internship.

About us

As the world's leading reinsurance company with more than 11,000 employees at over 50 locations, Munich Re introduces a paradigm shift in the way you think about insurance. By turning uncertainty into a manageable risk we enable fundamental change. Join us working on topics today that will concern society tomorrow, whether that be climate change, major construction projects, medical risk assessment or even space travel.

Together we embrace a culture where multiskilled teams dare to think big. We create the new and the different for our clients and cultivate innovation. Sounds like you? Push boundaries with us and be part of Munich Re. Our employees are our greatest strength. That’s why we offer them a wide range of benefits.

Unlock your potential
• Diversity, Equity & Inclusion: we embrace the power of differences and are convinced that diversity fosters innovation and resilience and enables us to act braver and better.
• Continuous Learning: we believe that continuous learning is a key differentiator and critical for building new skills and accelerating growth.
• Career Mobility: we actively support career mobility, and our strong global and regional presence offers a wealth of career growth opportunities for you.

Quant Portfolio Manager (f/m/d)

Join us. Let’s care for tomorrow.

At Allianz Global Investors we foster a culture of professionalism, fulfilment, and an inclusive working environment. Do you want to be part of a leading active asset management company? Then join us now!

A new opportunity has arisen for a Quant Portfolio Manager (f/m/d) in our risklab function.

risklab is the Solutions pillar on AllianzGI’s Investment Platform, as the expert for innovative investment and risk solutions across public and private markets. Over 60 investment professionals worldwide develop advisory services and manage portfolio solutions that are tailored to individual investment goals of our clients.

With your interest and skills in both investment management, derivatives and financial modelling, you will work on the design and further development of our quantitative investment strategies.

In this role, you will be responsible for customizing and managing client mandates and will work together with various functions including Distribution to serve our clients. You will present our strategies and the mandates in client meetings and act as a representative of the risklab team towards internal and external stakeholders.

In addition to your technical expertise, you will leverage a strong understanding of financial markets, asset classes, and macroeconomic factors to design, simulate, and implement investment strategies. A key part of your role will be applying your knowledge of portfolio construction, asset allocation, and risk management to real-world investment challenges.

This position will be based in Munich.

What you will do
• Manage portfolios, mainly derivatives-based cross-asset strategies, for institutional clients
• Drive continuous improvement by enhancing the investment process, also in collaboration with technology teams on process optimization and spearhead projects that elevate efficiency and scalability
• Take responsibility for client portfolios and their respective investment strategy
• Customize and manage client mandates, conduct client meetings and represent the team and capabilities internally and externally
• Develop and implement together with other quant specialists in the team new methods to further improve our investment process as well as our systematic investment strategy offering
• Work collaboratively with investment advisory and solutions specialists as well as full stack developers to translate respective needs and business requirements
• Conduct quantitative analyses for distribution and institutional clients and prepare material to present to clients

What you bring
• At least 7 years of professional experience in asset management with a focus on institutional client portfolios; direct background in the areas of dynamic asset allocation or derivatives-based strategies is a plus
• Portfolio management of multi asset solutions with risk management or overlay strategies or absolute return mandates utilizing a variety of instruments (primarily derivatives such as futures, forwards, swaps and options)
• University degree in Mathematics / Statistics / Physics / Computer Science with a background in Finance or Economics or related field of study with mathematical acumen
• Well-grounded knowledge of derivatives markets across various asset classes and related economic aspects
• Strong analytical skills and precision, which allow you to structure and solve complex problems combined with a high attention to detail, and accuracy in working with numbers
• Great presentation and communication skills and the ability to explain complex problems and solutions in a comprehensive way depending on the audience
• Ability to efficiently handle client requests to tight deadlines and to a high quality, including coordination between various teams
• Programming skills and experience with at least one object-oriented programming language such as Python, C# as well as Matlab are a plus
• Willingness and ability to work both independently and as part of a team, in an upbeat, fast-paced, business-critical environment
• Ambitious demeanour, passion for advancing new topics independently and taking responsibility for their implementation and success
• Proficiency in English and German both written and spoken

What we offer
• Flexible working from home and abroad according to internal guidelines (hybrid model/ flexible working hours/cross-border remote work)
• Access to pension/ savings plans/ Allianz products
• Family support (relocation/ childcare facilities)
• Company share purchasing plan
• Mental health and wellbeing programs
• Mobility solutions (Jobrad bike leasing, subvention Jobticket)
• Career opportunities within the entire Allianz Group
• Self-guided learning & development … and so much more!

Allianz Global Investors is a leading global active asset manager.

We invest for the long term and want to create value for clients every step of the way. We do this by being active – in how we partner with clients and anticipate their needs, and build solutions based on capabilities across public and private markets. Our focus on enhancing our clients’ assets leads naturally to a commitment to sustainability for positive change. Our goal is to enhance the investment experience for clients, whatever their location or goals.

Putting our clients' needs first, behaving in a transparent way and treating people fairly means acting with integrity. We encourage a collegial culture, that supports individual responsibility. We invest in the development of our employees to maximize the power of innovation.

We at Allianz believe in a diverse and inclusive workforce, we are committed to the principles of Equal Employment Opportunity and to helping applicants with any disabilities. We encourage you to bring your whole self to work, no matter where you are from, what you look like, who you love or what you believe in. We therefore welcome applications regardless of ethnicity or cultural background, age, gender, nationality, religion, disability or sexual orientation. Great to have you on board.

If you feel inspired to promote the active asset management experience, this is the place for you. Join our diverse, international, technology-enabled, and agile environment. Simply upload your CV in English to apply for this position! If you need support to navigate our websites or at any stage during your application, please send an email with your request to recruiting@allianzgi.com

description:
Get AI-powered advice on this job and more exclusive features.

Fluency in English (German language not a must)

About:

Headquartered in Germany, our client is an independent investment firm operating as a family office. Its portfolio spans private markets, liquid assets, and public markets, with over half allocated to private equity and credit across sectors in the EU and US. The firm is seeking an Investment Strategy & Quantitative Analyst to join its Hamburg office.

The Role:

The Investment Strategy & Quantitative Analyst will collaborate closely with the Head of Portfolio Management & Analytics, playing a pivotal role in shaping investment decisions across the firm’s portfolio, which spans private markets, liquid assets, and public markets. This position presents a distinctive opportunity to engage in portfolio construction, asset allocation, and investment analysis across multiple asset classes, with a strong emphasis on quantitative methodologies . The successful candidate will work alongside the Portfolio Manager, gaining invaluable exposure to sophisticated investment strategies while actively contributing to the firm’s strategic shift toward direct investments.

Key Responsibilities
• Assist in portfolio management by analyzing investments across private markets, liquid assets, and public markets.
• Conduct financial modeling and statistical analysis to support investment decisions.
• Develop and refine investment models, including Monte Carlo simulations and other quantitative frameworks, to assess risk and return dynamics.
• Support the evaluation of co-investments, secondaries, and advisor-led allocations.
• Analyze market trends, economic indicators, and investment opportunities across asset classes to enhance portfolio performance.
• Work closely with internal stakeholders and external advisors to optimize investment strategy.
• Contribute to the firm’s expansion into direct investments by conducting due diligence and structuring transactions.

Candidate Profile
• 2+ years of experience in investment analysis, financial modeling, or a quantitative role within private markets, asset management, or a related field.
• Strong proficiency in Excel, with experience in advanced financial modeling . Exposure to statistical analysis, probability modeling, or Monte Carlo simulations is highly desirable, or a strong inclination to develop in this direction.
• Excellent mathematical and analytical skills , with a structured and detail-oriented approach.
• Understanding of private credit, private equity, liquid assets, public markets, or alternative investments is a must.
• Ability to synthesize complex data and present actionable insights.
• Strong intellectual curiosity and eagerness to develop expertise in portfolio management.

title: Quantitative Trading Analyst (f/m/d)
description:
XTP is a specialist consultant focusing on transparency, cost, and risk. For more than 20 years we have helped institutional investors to get the most from their current investment set-up and enhance investment governance. We have a proven track record of increasing implementation efficiency in public and private market assets from clients across Europe and the USA.

We are a data-driven organisation with a highly experienced team of more than 50 senior industry specialists, quantitative analysts, and software engineers. Technology is a fundamental component of how we operate and underpins our ability to deliver superior outcomes.

XTP is building an international culture where our team feels empowered, responsible, and valued. We can offer you access to bright-minded people, the environment to develop your knowledge further, and a platform to make a difference in financial services in public and private markets.Your Activities
• Perform quantitative analysis on liquid asset portfolio (stocks, bonds, derivatives, …) of our institutional clients such as pension funds and (re)insurers.
• Create cost transparency by calculating, processing, and benchmarking of explicit and implicit trading and investment costs.
• Synthesize your results in presentations and hold those in front of our clients and their asset managers.
• Increase the net return of our clients’ liquid assets by improving cost efficiency based on the results of your analysis.
• Develop new quantitative models and software tools to enhance process automation and to improve the handling of large amounts of trading and market data.
• Grow with us and take over more project responsibilities.

Your Profile
• Strong quantitative skills and high affinity to numbers – you believe that data analytics are cool.
• Strong academic background in mathematics, physics, or finance.
• Intrinsic motivation to tackle and solve complex quantitative issues.
• You consider precision as a principle, not as a burden.
• Self-driven, very well organized, and a results-oriented team player.
• Excel is your friend (just finding the icon does not count).
• Experience in software development and databases is an advantage.
• Highly proficient in English and German.

Sende uns Deinen Lebenslauf ganz einfach über unsere Karriereseite.

030 – 89021 – 327

• Unternehmensgröße 251-500
Über uns

Wir revolutionieren die deutsche Bankbranche.

Aber keine Sorge: Wir haben friedliche Absichten. Auch wenn unser Namensgeber als antiker Kriegsgott andere Assoziationen wecken könnte. Dabei sind wir alles andere als antik, sondern als modernste Privatbank Vorreiter eines neuen, fairen Banksystems.

Unser innovatives Geschäftsmodell: Wir beraten Kunden ausschließlich gegen Honorar und finanzieren uns nicht über die im Finanzbereich sonst üblichen Provisionen. Warum wir das machen? Weil wir nur so unabhängig beraten können und nicht vom Verkauf einzelner Produkte getrieben sind.

Unsere Kollegen schätzen das familiäre Arbeitsklima, wie die Auszeichnung als »Top Arbeitgeber Mittelstand« vom Focus belegt.
Aber überzeugen Sie sich selbst – wir freuen uns, Sie kennenzulernen!

• Collaborate with portfolio managers, quantitative researchers, and software architects to integrate quantitative insights into investment strategies

Bei uns hast du die Chance, in einer dynamischen Zukunftsbranche an der Umsetzung der Energiewende mitzuwirken.
